meaning: to make something less severe or intense
sentence: The government introduced new policies to alleviate poverty in the region.

meaning: honest and straightforward even when the truth might be unpleasant
sentence: She gave a candid assessment of the challenges facing the project.

meaning: very careful and precise about details
sentence: He was meticulous in planning eveyr aspect of the wedding.

meaning: able to recover quickly from difficulties or adapt to change
sentence: Children are often more resilient than adults when faced with adversity.

meaning: perfect and without any mistakes or faults
sentence: Her impreccable manners made a great impression on her colleagues.

meaning: not securely held or in a stable position; dangerous or likely to collapse
sentence: The climber found himself in a precarious position on the edge of the cliff.

meaning: open to more than one interpretation; unclear
sentence: The instructions were so ambiguous that nobody knew what to do.

meaning: fluent and persuasive in speaking or writing
sentence: The politician's eloquent speech inspired thousands of people.

meaning: to publicly support or recommend a cause or policy
sentence: He is known to advocate for environmental sustainability.

meaning: confusing or difficult to understand
sentence: The puzzle was so perplexing that even the experts struggled to solve it.

meaning: very detailed and complicated
sentence: The artist's intricate designs were admired by everyone at the gallery.

meaning: seeming reasonable or likely to be true
sentence: Her explanation for being late sounded plausible so I accepted it.

meaning: to think deeply about something for a long time
sentence: He spent hours contemplating the consequences of his decision.

meaning: suggesting something bad or unpleasant is going to happen
sentence: The dark sky looked ominous before the storm began.

meaning: certain to happen and impossible to avoid
sentence: After weeks of heavy rain/ flooding seemed inevitable

meaning: not obvious or easy to notice
sentence: She noticed a subtle change in his tone of voice.

meaning: about to happen very soon
sentence: The dark clouds signaled that a storm was imminent.

meaning: to express a thought/feeling or idea so that it is understood by other people
sentence: The teacher used simple examples to convey complex ideas to the students.

meaning: able to adapt to many different functions or activities
sentence: The jack is so versatile that you can wear it in any season.

meaning: to begin or start something
sentence: The meeting will commence as soon as all participants arrive

meaning: deserving attention or notice; remarkable
sentence: The scientist's contributions to the field are truly noteworthy.

meaning: to make something less harmful/ unpleasant/ or bad:
sentence: It is unclear how to mitigate the effects of tourism on the island.

meaning: to prevent something; especially a system; process; or event; from continuing as usual or as expected
sentence: Heavy snow disrupted travel into the city this morning.

meaning: happening after something else
sentence: The book discusses his illness and subsequent resignation from politics.

meaning: too much
sentence: Excessive exercise can sometimes cause health problems.

meaning: ability to work as intended or to succeed
sentence: Rising costs are threatening the viability of many businesses.

meaning: clear and detailed; leaving no room for confusion
sentence: I gave her very explicit directions how to get there.

meaning: to end an activity or custom officialy
sentence: National Service was abolished in the UK in 1962

meaning: to make a serious or formal promise to give or do something:
sentence: We are asking people to pledge their support for our campaign

meaning: a change or changes made to the words of a text:
sentence: He insisted that the book did not need amendment.

meaning: able to be made/done or achieved
sentence: With the extra resources the project is now feasible.

meaning: continuing without becoming weaker or less intense; persistent
sentence: The relentless heat of the desert made our journey exhausting.

meaning: to formally praise someone or something
sentence: The judge commended her for her bravery.

meaning: to make something possible or easier
sentence: The new software will facilitate communication between departments.

meaning: in an honest and direct way
sentence: She spoke very frankly about her experiences.

meaning: a fault/ mistake or weakness that makes something imperfect.
sentence: The diamond was beautiful but it had a tiny flaw that reduced its value.

meaning: to limit an activity/ person/ or problem in some way:
sentence: Let's confine our discussion to the matter in question/ please!

meaning: to come to an opinion about something/ or have a belief about something
sentence: How do the French perceive the British?

meaning: to allow yourself or another person to have something enjoyable/ especially more than is good for you
sentence: I love champagne but I don't often indulge myself.

meaning: something that is distinctive is easy to recognize because it is different from other things
sentence: She's got a very distinctive voice.

meaning: to watch something or someone carefully to learn more about it.
sentence: The role of scientists is to observe and describe the world/ not to try to control it.

meaning: something that is gripping is so interesting or exciting that it holds your attention completely:
sentence: I found the book so gripping that I couldn't put it down.

meaning: boring
sentence: The problem is I find most forms of exercise so tedious.

meaning: felt or experienced very strongly or in an extreme way:
sentence: His mother's death when he was aged six had a very profound effect on him.

meaning: large in quantity and expensive or impressive:
sentence: She threw a lavish party/ complete with gourmet food/ live music/ and extravagant decorations.

meaning: to not give enough care or attention to people or things that are your responsibility
sentence: She's been neglecting her studies this semester.

meaning: famous/ respected or important
sentence: an eminent historian

meaning: to say something again/ once or several times
sentence: The government has reiterated its refusal to compromise with terrorists.

meaning: large in size/ value or importance
sentence: The company made a substantial inverstment in renewable energy projects.

meaning: solving problems in a practical and realistic way/ based on what actually works in the current situation/ rather than following strict theories or rules
sentence: In business/ taking a pragmatic approach to problems is often more successful than being too idealistic

meaning: if someone is coherent/ you can understand what that person says:
sentence: Her argument was clear and coherent/ making it easy to understand.

meaning: not willing to do something and therefore slow to do it
sentence: I was having such a good time I was reluctant to leave.

meaning: to make someone less confident/ less powerful/ or less likely to succeed/ or to make something weaker/ often gradually
sentence: The president has accused two cabinet members of working secretly to undermine his position.

meaning: that is the reason or explanation for
sentence: His mother was Italian/ hence his name - Luca.

meaning: unusual and strange/ sometimes in an unpleasant way
sentence: She has the most peculiar ideas.

meaning: including many different types of people or things
sentence: Students from countries as diverse as Colombia and Lithuania use Cambridge textbooks.

meaning: unaware of what is happening around
sentence: She was oblivious to the noise outside.

meaning: to imitate someone or something with the aim of matching or exceeding their qualities/ achievements/ or abilities
sentence: She tried to emulate her older sister's success by working hard in school.

meaning: a feeling of respect for someone or something
sentence: She shows great reverence for her professors.

meaning: period of the day when light from the sun begins to appear in the sky
sentence: We woke at dawn

meaning: a small preview or sample of something
sentence: The first chapter of the book was a foretaste of the thrilling adventure ahead.

meaning: a natural ability or sport
sentence: My son has little aptitude for sport.

meaning: objects that are made out of clay by hand
sentence: They sell pottery and other handmade goods.

meaning: to make someone remember sth or feel an emotion
sentence: That smell always evokes memories of my old school.

meaning: to happen or exist after the other repeatedly
sentence: She alternated between cheefulness and deep despair.

meaning: to know about something before it happens
sentence: Nobody could foresee how quickly technology would transform our daily lives.

meaning: to make people follow a rule or law
sentence: It isn't always easy for the police to enforce speed limits.

meaning: an urgent and emotional request
sentence: It isn't always easy for the police to enforce speed limits.

meaning: to take a long time to leave or disappear
sentence: The smell from the fire still lingered days later.

meaning: skilled and experienced:
sentence: a proficient swimmer

meaning: having (legal) responsibility for something or someone:
sentence: The law holds parents liable if a child does not attend school.

meaning: detailed and careful
sentence: a thorough revision of the guidelines.

meaning: to make a choice/ especially of one thing or possiblity instead of others
sentence: Mike opted for early retirement.

meaning: the act of judding or determining the value/ quality or importance of something
sentence: Would you say that is a fair assessment of the situation?

meaning: to control or influence something directly/ or decide what will happen
sentence: The commitee will determine the winner tomorrow.

meaning: to officially force a rule/ tax/ punishment/ etc. to be obeyed or received
sentence: The government imposed new rules on the industry.

meaning: to follow orders/ rules/ or instructions
sentence: Children must obey their parents' rules for their safety.

meaning: smoothly/ so that you don't notice any change between one part and another
sentence: The computer animation blends seamlessly with the rest of the film.

meaning: a situation in which someone loses their job because their employer does not need them
sentence: Thousands of factory workers are facing redundancy

meaning: short and clear/ without unnecessary details
sentence: Make your answers clear and concise.

meaning: wanting to do or have something/ especially something interesting or enjoyable
sentence: She was eager to start her new job and make a good impression.

meaning: to accept something enthusiastically
sentence: She chose to embance the change.

meaning: very great sadness/ especially at the death of someone
sentence: Her grief at her son's death was terrible.

meaning: experiencing difficulty and problems
sentence: Ted asked me if I could help him fix his ailing car.

meaning: to assume something is true without proof/ often based on likelihood
sentence: I presume she'll arrive on time.
